Michael Stack wrote:
> jirka_sherpa wrote:
>> My second question is about possibility to configure rules in order to
>> accept all within some domains to level 1 and moreover all what is
>> linked from this pages what is outside the domain up to level 2 (it
>> mean to extend it somehow). I know there is a 'also-check-via' wich
>> enable to make this one hop outside the domain but i need something
>> more general for 2 or even more steps. It's possible?

> You might entertain writing your own custom rule to suit your particular 
> requirements. They're easy to do and test outside of a running crawl.

For background, we have a pending request for "n-hops-off" 
functionality; see:

[ 1289245 ] n-hops-off decide rule / focus plus N hops scoping
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1289245&group_id=73833&atid=539102

Its notes suggest one possible approach.

Some of the work on 'heritable' CrawlURI properties done in this 
(finished) RFE could be applicable:

[ 1119608 ] Carry forward (& log) 'originating URL/seed' for all URLs
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1119608&group_id=73833&atid=539102

There's no certainty that the above "n-hops-off" RFE will be prioritized 
for one of the next few releases... so you may want to implement this 
yourself, and in such a case we'd very much welcome it as a contribution 
to the main codebase. (Also, there may be other or better ways to do 
this than the notes in the above issues suggest.)

- Gordon @ IA
